posts.post_content: If Magic has taught us anything, it is to watch for 2/1 creatures with strange abilities. I see this fitting into control as a creature that allows your cantrips to BLOCK. The sheer tempo stopping, combo enabling, overrun threatening power makes this a card to kill or lose to.

posts.post_content: This guy's only an uncommon, but he's one of red's best contenders for the "broken two-drop creature" cycle. (The other colors have [Tarmogoyf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tarmogoyf), [Stoneforge Mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stoneforge Mystic), [Snapcaster Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Snapcaster Mage), and [Dark Confidant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Confidant).)

posts.post_content:
This is my favorite card of the set, hands down. Great design, perfectly costed and balanced. Art is sick, and so is the flavor text. To anyone who didn't know:  
  
im·mo·late  
1. To kill as a sacrifice.  
2. To kill (oneself) by fire.  
3. To destroy.  
  
5/5 for a literally perfect card.
posts.html:
This is my favorite card of the set, hands down. Great design, perfectly costed and balanced. Art is sick, and so is the flavor text. To anyone who didn't know:

im·mo·late
1. To kill as a sacrifice.
2. To kill (oneself) by fire.
3. To destroy.

5/5 for a literally perfect card.
